com.linkedin.parseq.promise

Class DelegatingPromise<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linkedin.parseq.promise.DelegatingPromise<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Promise<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseTask

    public class DelegatingPromise<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Promise<T>
    An abstract class that makes it easy to delegate Promise method invocations to a delegate promise.
    Author:
    Chris Pettitt (cpettitt@linkedin.com)

      Constructors

      Blocks the current thread for up to the specified amount of time or until the promise has been resolved.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public T get()
      throws PromiseException
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        If the promise's value is set, then this method returns the value. If the promise has an error, the error is thrown, wrapped in a PromiseException. If the promise has not yet been resolved (i.e. it has no value and no error) then this method raises a PromiseUnresolvedException.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Promise<T>
        Returns:
        the value of the promise if it is available
        Throws:
        PromiseException - if the promise has an error
        PromiseUnresolvedException - if the promise has not yet been resolved

      • getError

        public java.lang.Throwable getError()
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Returns the error in this promise, if there is one. If this promise contains a value, then this method will return null. If this promise has no value and no error (i.e. it is unresolved) then a PromiseUnresolvedException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        getError in interface Promise<T>
        Returns:
        the error contained in this promise, or null if the promise contains a value.

      • getOrDefault

        public T getOrDefault(T defaultValue)
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Gets the value in this promise or, if the promise contains an error, returns the given default value. This is one mechanism for gracefully handling promise failure.

        If the promise has not been resolved then this method will throw PromiseUnresolvedException.

        Specified by:
        getOrDefault in interface Promise<T>
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to return if this promise contains an error.
        Returns:
        the value in this promise or the default value if this promise contains an error.

      • await

        public void await()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Blocks the current thread for an unbounded amount of time until the promise has be resolved.

        For asynchronous workflows, use Promise.addListener(PromiseListener), which will notify the user when the promise is resolved instead of blocking the current thread.

        Specified by:
        await in interface Promise<T>
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted

      • await

        public boolean await(long time,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Blocks the current thread for up to the specified amount of time or until the promise has been resolved. If the promise was resolved before the specified time has expired, this method returns true.

        For asynchronous workflows, use Promise.addListener(PromiseListener), which will notify the user when the promise is resolved instead of blocking the current thread.

        Specified by:
        await in interface Promise<T>
        Parameters:
        time - the amount of time to wait
        unit - the units for the wait time
        Returns:
        true if the promise is resolved within the specified time
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted

      • addListener

        public void addListener(PromiseListener<T> listener)
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Adds a listener to this promise that will be notified when the promise is resolved. If the promise has already been resolved then the listener is notified immediately.

        Listener will be called on a thread that completed this promise.

        Specified by:
        addListener in interface Promise<T>
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add to this promise

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Returns true if this promise is resolved. A promise is resolved when it has a value or an error.
        Specified by:
        isDone in interface Promise<T>
        Returns:
        true if this promise has been resolved.

      • isFailed

        public boolean isFailed()
        Description copied from interface: Promise
        Returns true if the promise has an error. Errors can retrieved using Promise.getError().
        Specified by:
        isFailed in interface Promise<T>
        Returns:
        true if the promise has en error.

        protected Promise<T> getDelegate()
